reviews.review: not as good overall as the first movie.  of course the animation and singing were still amazing, but this felt more like a made for DVD kind of feature.

Poor excuse for new outfits and selling toys.  Went in disappointed to pay full price, since disney revolked discounts on it's movies, only to wish we had never gone in and left.
I liked The Movie so did my 2 niece's. thank you
We loved the movie, my oldest son loves that theres more action in it and its more funny.

I really enjoyed this movie. The story line is great, the music is good, and it overall is a good second movie. Not once did I see the undertones of ugly accusations that some reviewer's have said that Elsa is out of the closet. Not what this Disney movie is about!!
The story was all over the place. The graphics were great but the first one was alot better.
the kids like it and there were some funny parts.  definitely not as good as the original.

The story:  formulaic, predictable
The music: mediocre
The animation:  fabulous

The second (and hopefully final) movie in the Frozen franchise is everything that the first movie was not: boring, mediocre, rehash, and predictable.

The songs were trying hard to be hits, but fell flat. Frozen 1 had terrific, inspired songs, catchy tunes, universal themes.  Frozen 2 had... songs that were loud and large (especially in imax) yet were boring and uninspiring.  I doubt they will sell very many soundtracks.

The story... well, this type of movie is mostly a vehicle for fantastic animation, so you don't expect too much plot, certainly nothing believable, yet there ought to be at least a modicum of consistency and logic to make the story flow smoothly. That was essentially lacking here; the baloney explanations about angry magic spirits were contrived.  

It seemed like the story writers were just making stuff up as they went along, trying to fit plot chapters to the big screen animation scenes rather than the other way around.  "Let's have some huge, angry stone giants chasing them!  Think up a rationalization for that!" and so forth.

The water spirit thing was downright silly.  It came in the shape of a horse that attacked Elsa in the water, trying to drown her, but Elsa escaped and ultimately tamed the horse with some kind of ice halter.  Or something.  From that point on, the horse or water spirit or whatever it was, was completely tame and friendly and allowed her to ride it all over the region.  I mean, why not just create an ice boat complete with sails and rudder, and pilot that across the ocean? Or just freeze the ocean. She's obviously powerful enough.

The fire spirit was... a newt?  Or a frog, or something.  After disastrously setting the forest on fire, it was tamed by Else who chased it and then... acted friendly toward it. The newt was cute, smiled and winked, and you know they were thinking about merchandise the entire time they were designing this thing.

Yeah, the rest of the story was just unbelievable and cringe-inducing at times.  But as I mentioned, the animation was fabulous.  It's advanced to the point where you wonder, why don't they just draw life-like humans instead of these huge-eyed doll-like beings?  The 360 degree camera angles, the zoom-in and zoom-out effects, and general attention to detail were exquisite.  Now if only they had added a great plot and music to match this state-of-the-art animation, it would have truly been a great movie on a par with the first one.
